newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai rice ends little changed in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai rice ends little changed in slow trade.

text.p: Shanghai rice futures ended little changed in dull trading on Thursday with investors continuing to move their money into other active markets, traders said.
The key October contract ended unchanged at 1,900 yuan ($228) per tonne. It opened at an intra-day high of 1,940 and hit a low of 1,899. December fell 60 to 1,950 yuan per tonne.
Combined volume rose to 3,000 tonnes from 600.
Traders said long and short position holders continued to move their money out of the rice market into other more active markets due to a lack of market-moving news.
"The active stock markets in Shanghai and Shenzhen attracted much hot money from retail investors," one trader said.
Traders expect rice to trade on thin volume in the next few days.
